episode_summary: In this Christmas special episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish', the hosts present a selection of quirky and fascinating facts submitted by their live audience. The episode features discussions on unusual topics such as hairy tongues, a dog from 'Gladiator' appearing in 'EastEnders', the density of frozen meatballs setting off metal detectors, and the secretive nature of the Angostura bitters recipe.

facts.fact: Some people can grow hair on their tongues.

In Gladiator, released in 2000, Russell Crowe had a dog, quite ferocious dog, played by a dog called Kite, who was a Belgian shepherd, apparently a terveur in Belgian shepherd. Anyway, she went on to be well-arred in EastEnders.
In Switzerland it's illegal to flush the toilet after 10 p.m.
It is possible to make a tuba out of material other than brass, and somebody once made one from cheese. And it sounded okay.
